page.title: 06Portobello Cottage.
page.content: Portobello Cottage has a partly thatched roof.Some of the thatch is {Norfolk reed.}There was some slate put on in 1900.There was some tiling put on some time this century.The Cottage was made in 1650.The back garden is 110 feet long and it is as wide as the house. The Davies family lived there for 2 years and before them the Humphreys for 20 years.Mrs. Morley, our infant teacher lives there now, with her husband and two boys, but she is leaving the area soon.There are 8 rooms; three of them are double bedrooms.The cottage is unusal because it has got the{original weather {boarding.}We do not know why it was called Portobello Cottage .By the cottage there is Portobello House.In London there is a street called Portobello Road. There is a place in Scotland called Portobello.
